user_review: *Currently open from 10pm - 3am*During the Ramadan (the fasting month for Muslims) this is the ideal late night snack to satisfy all those cravings that have been building up during the day!Despite having a slightly limited menu right now due to the current situation, they still had an array of options; delicious fillings inside freshly made traditional Lebanese Kaek bread. The owners are extremely hospitable and warm, welcoming us with a big smile. Make sure to ask them the story behind this famous hanging bread!We ordered a philly cheese steak kaek and shish taouk kaek which was made to absolute perfection. Delicious flavourful meat with fresh vegetables and oozing with cheese! Each and every bite was heavenly. Whilst waiting for my order and watching the fresh bread in production, I had to take a bag of them home for myself! Cannot wait to return once things are back to normal to see their fresh vegetable salad bar and build my own custom kaek! Highly recommend if you are in the area (was worth driving from the South Shore for!)

Sandwicherie Ka'ek is a small place bellow Hinnawi Bros near Concordia. It has a huge oven and makes the bread fresh. There's a variety of fillings you can get, from savory to sweet (e.g. Nutella). We went today for a light lunch. The kaek was really good, freshly made with fragrant sesame seeds all over the surface. The dough had a nice chew near the "handle", and its thin hollow structure was perfect for fillings. We got the Royal Shishtaook, which contained grilled chicken, pickles, vegs, fries and a delicious sauce. Pretty good place to grab a quick lunch!

It is a great place, small place that reminds me of Lebanon. The Kaek is so good! If you are walking downtown and wanna grab a quick snack, you there they have a lot of choices!They also have one with nutella inside!

Newish place next to concordia H building that I almost overlooked.They sell these lebanese style sandwiches. Was pretty good when I went and it was a decent price ($8). I got the cheese option and It was good but I think what makes it just an ok for me is the cleanliness of the restaurant. It just looked really sad and unkept. But that doesn't really take away from the food  Food is a 3.5 stars.

Little Lebanese place in front of Concordia University where they make sesame bread sandwiches. Interesting and original concept and their sandwiches are good. One sandwich is about 8$. They also offer unlimited tea!

My favorite restaurant downtown! Authentic, inexpensive, and tastes fantastic. If you're really hungry try the chicken fajita or shish taouk. If you're looking for something light, my favorite is the labneh zaatar. You also get a free tea with your sandwiche! What else would you want?

If you're in the mood for a quick bite in the area, this is a good place to grab a sandwich. The bread is a Lebanese bread covered in sesame seeds. Lots of choices for fillings. They cooked the meat as you order. Overall, pretty good!

I had originally ordered one Ka'ek (Philly steak), when I ate it, I walked out the door with three more. This place is insane ! The sandwich is a bit messy and awkward to eat but it's really worth it ! The restaurant is a bit small but good for a quick bite or pick-up. Highly recommended!

Nice if you haven't tried ka'ek especially because the dough was plenty chewy. However flavour was lacking in some of the options. 4-stars for the Breakfast Ka'ek which was the best one of the three we tried, especially for the runny egg yolk.
